definition: tree trunk/main part of sth/to manage/to work/to do/capable/cadre/to kill (slang)/to fuck (vulgar)
ability/talent/sb of a certain type/a capable individual/only/only then/just now

sentences.english: That's why farmers cut and store their hay when it's dry.
sentences.chinese: 所以農民割完草要等草幹才貯藏起來。

sentences.english: Sharp intention cures, utterly loyal, is a talented individual on the political.
sentences.chinese: 銳意圖治，忠心耿耿，政治上是一位幹才。

sentences.english: The president's quick of affairs and his energy astounded the staff.
sentences.chinese: 總裁的幹才和精力都讓我們驚異。

sentences.english: Subordinating everything to the war effort means just this.
sentences.chinese: 必須這樣幹才叫做服從戰爭。

sentences.english: We'll have to work very hard to catch the other company up.
sentences.chinese: 我們必須努力幹才能夠趕上另一家公司。

sentences.english: Therefore, the nine fort towns were set up to defend the frontier, where some defending talents showed themselves.
sentences.chinese: 明設九鎮防邊，一批戍邊幹才脫穎而出。

sentences.english: This is not easy, and may require two porpoises working together.
sentences.chinese: 這並非易事，可能需要兩隻海豚合夥幹才行。

sentences.english: Yes, the administration needed experienced hands.
sentences.chinese: 沒錯，政府需要有經驗的幹才。

sentences.english: He is looking ahead, to when his fields are dry enough that he can start planting.
sentences.chinese: 他正展望未來，當他的田地足夠幹才可以開始種植。

definition: to be in overall charge/to oversee
Zhang Juzheng (1525-1582), Grand Secretary during the Ming dynasty, credited with bringing the dynasty to its apogee
running of armed forces/military management/to govern armed forces/to direct troops
Zou Yan (305-240 BC), founder of the School of Yin-Yang of the Warring States Period (475-221 BC)
to love the common people as one's own children (praise for a virtuous ruler)
scramble for power and profit (idiom); power struggle
strict/serious/solemn/dignified/to tidy up/to clean up/to purge/to adjust
